Counter Strike is known for being the most strategical, and pin-point accurate multiplayer shooter game, so it is no surprise that it ended up on the Source engine after the major popularity of the first game. Experienced players will note the slight differences in gameplay if they are used to the original Counter Strike, and will often cite the original as superior. It is highly debated which Counter Strike is more deserving of the title of "Best Counter Strike". This Source version however, regardless of the gameplay elements, does improve on UI, Graphics, Sound, and modding capability.

One of the worst games I've ever played.

No, I'm not joking and not trolling.  I know this is gonna be downvoted to DARE say that CS in general is not the best game series in existence, but this is at least more insightful than the short "best game ever" reviews on Steam.  I've played for 20-30 hours over a week a few years ago, I doubt anything has changed since this game rarely gets updated.

#1:  Too many mods and vanilla content is unclear.

After setting up the options for the mouse and video settings, I clicked the MSFont based server browser and a list of over 10,000+ servers appeared.  Majority of them are mods and you will have to look through names and tags to see which is what.  Now for vanilla CS.


#2:  The menu system is awful.

I go into a server where a menu pops up, asking to pick a character.  This menu looks like something that was coded by someone who just found Unity Free.  It's a very flat, static, shadowed overlay that doesn't say anything useful except the gun names and prices.  Pick a team.  The teams have different starting locations and a few of the guns are switched around.  Picking a character has no consequence except for Snow man, who's not useful on any maps.  The gun menu is the worst because there are no statistics saying what purpose they serve or how they compare against each other.  The information listed is the real world stats of the guns, not how they will perform in-game.

A SWAT team has to purchase all their equipment before they invade a terrorist cell???

What is the pupose in this thing?  I'm given a set value of money and I have to buy all my equipment.  Every.  Single.  Round.  I'm given less than 5 seconds to do so.  This is why CS players will recommend I find a tutorial and learn how to bind quick purchase slots to my keyboard.  I can save my weapon loadouts into a quick buy slot, but only AFTER I purchase all my gear during a round.  After 15-30 seconds at the start of the round, I can't buy anything else.

This is unacceptable.

Quick tip, if you buy a lot of things, you're soon gonna end up with no money.  You will be forced to use your starting pistol instead of being useful to the team.  The game is unforigivng like that.


#3:  TURN THE VOLUME DOWN!  WAIT!  TURN IT BACK UP!

This is a bad move either way, because the guns are ear splittingly loud if you didn't turn it down in the options menu.  The problem is you NEED to have the volume up so you can hear the footsteps of the other players.  It's the only way to tell how close enemy players are besides gunfire.  You will have to strain your ears to hear it, make a guess as to how close they are and from which direction they're coming from.  That is until you hear the guns again.


#4:  The community is as childish as they come.

A lot of players may deny this, but the servers I've played on say otherwise.  I've heard people bitch about how somebody might be hacking, blasting bad music through their microphones, make crude jokes about being abused, and a few who sound like they have barely been through puberty (or are women with a serious vocal disorder).  It's on par with most XBox Live games.

Ask any player as well and they'll brag how they've played this game off and on for well over a decade, how they've racked up several thousand hours honing their skills, and playing tournaments for big-cash money.  Namely, everything I hate about the "Hardcore" types.


#5:  The target audience of CS is only for the most Hardcore of FPS players.

A painted child's sign needs to be on the store page to reflect this game and its users.  "No scrubs and nobody else allowed."

The movement and weapon handling isn't like anything I've ever felt before, and I've played FPS games since Wolfenstein 3D was a new release.  Imagine if you took a Quake-like game (the movement speed and general attitude in a public server) then cross it with an Arma-style tactical shooter (weapons, gear, and health).  Players will rush forward to a predefined location where the opposing team will be or hang back in order to snipe players.

Once you start firing, you will quickly realize the guns kick like a mule and it's difficult to hit anyone from a distance after the first couple bullets or on the move.  Crouching down and sitting still is almost recommended to be able to get accurate shots, but it leaves you incredibly vulnerable to other players.

The reticle is only a suggestion as to where the bullets will land as the reticle doesn't expand well enough to compensate for the real accuracy.  You will have to practice in an empty server, create your own, or find a Deathmatch server in order to tell which gun is best for what purpose.

The handling of the weapons are very subtle and it's hard to tell at first how the guns behave.  The game doesn't tell you how powerful they are, how much accuracy they have, how much it affects your movement, how much recoil, how big the magazines are, the firing mode, and any options.  You need to play CS for MANY hours in order to try to determine how well they fair.

When you die, you will be stuck in spectator mode until the round is over.  Nothing else to do except watch and wait.  It gives some excitement and pushes you to not die, but it's boring and tedious to wait for another respawn to do the same song and dance all over again.

And yes, you will die.  A lot.  Headshots for anybody playing this game are extremely common and people snapping their crosshairs over peoples head.  It kinda give creedence to people yelling HACKS a lot.


#6:  Hackers are common.

wikipedia dot org/wiki/Counter_strike#Cheating

You know how bad the situation is?  The only other "Cheating" seciton I've found in Wikipedia is World Of Warcraft.  People will point out that CS uses Valve's VAC system is still being worked on, but It doesn't work since it's still a huge problem within any of the CS games.  This is what happens when you have a game made so Hardcore, that cheating is preferred by many instead of playing legit.

No joke, In 1 day, I went into 3 servers and found hackers in their.  The first had 1 dash forward and head murdered the entire opposing team before we could get out of spawn.  The 2nd had teams who snap aimed all day before I had a chance to spot them.  The 3rd had 6 or more screwing around...  And it wasn't a mod server.


#7:  Bad mods.

Before playing a mod server, just stop and read a walkthrough for it before entering.  You'll become completely lost as to what the objectives are or how to stay alive if you don't.  The worst ones: Hide-N-Seek and Jail RP.  Hide-N-Seek is easy to win.  Become the smallest thing, hide in a corner of the map, don't move.  For Jail RP, look up Stanford Prison Experiment in Google.  Worth a read.  Pointless mod.  There's a predator mod, but The Hidden: Source is better.  Go play Tribes: Ascend instead of playing any of the Surfing maps too.  At least you don't get a lot of pits of death like in CS.  Left 4 Dead 2 is better than anything CS Zombies could ever put out.  (CS Zombies have 10,000 HP and a 1 hit kill.  GOOD LUCK!)

The only worthy mod I've found is Gun Game or Team Deathmatch since it gets down to playing with the gun mechanics instead of focusing heavily on teamplay and respawning.  Everything else has been done better in other games.


Verdict:  This game is just flat out awful most of the time to anybody starting out.  I know I'm not the best FPS player and getting headshots is getting difficult with each passing year, but this game is rediculous.  You have to be at an extremely high level compared to the average FPS game and it's unfriendly to newbies.  People who like challenge will find this appealing, but this is not a good game to anybody else.

Instead of playing CS, just play any one of these and you'll have a better time.

howtogeek dot com/131216/the-best-free-online-first-person-shooter-fps-games
Still a good game, years later.

Хороший шутер сделанный компанией Valve. Дата выхода: 1 ноября 2004 года. Много различных модов сделанных на эту игру. Такие как "Зомби", "ДМ", "Джайл" и тд. Вообщем скучать не придется.  Хорошие тени и графика того времени ждут вас.
